rComments: Turned a class about basic film techniques into an ultra-liberal tirade about feminism and grassroots movements. Liked to litter her lectures full of pretentious unnecessary words and phrases in hopes of appearing intelligent and professional. When she wasn't hammering us with her agenda, she actually made the class pretty interesting.

Her favorite words are "geopolitical" and "framework". She attempts to scare people away at the first class meeting, but the work is actually very easy. Just a few papers throughout the course and you watch a movie every week. She goes off on tangents, but they're usually fine. She likes to make jokes and show off how liberal she is.

She presented the material in a compelling and engaging way, including a fantastic compilation of articles and films. I found this one of the most uniquely inspirational classes I have ever taken. However, I did not like the in-class group work at all. I also did not care for the school-marmish way she sometimes ran the class.
She's an AMAZING professor! She knows her stuff and shows great foreign films, with horrible subtitles at times, nonetheless, she's great and incorporated global issues into everyday cinemas.

BLOODY HORRIBLE teacher!!! Turned an intro "Film Experience" class into an upper-div gender studies class. Not a strong speaker, afraid of and rebelious towards the class, leaves room for comments... ONLY if they agree with her own views. There was actually a petition that went around in a class of hundreds of students to have her fired.

She's a redundant whiny ****. There, I said it. She is really into the material, but in a really annoying way. The entire class she was hung up on how horrible society is and she never talked about anything else. Also she always restates everything she says, sometimes four or five times which adds to the feeling that the class is going nowhere.

It's a pretty easy class--a total of 3 open-ended papers on gender and sexuality. Campos looks like a cross between Nia Vardalos (from my Big Fat Greek Wedding) and Tina Fey from SNL. She's pretty awesome and funny, but she really hates capitalism and can go off on it forever. Other than that, it's cool.

Took Genders and Sexualities.. it's alright. I think it's an interesting topic but only within the the scope of Darshan's own opinions. Later in the quarter she tried to explain her personal feelings about society, capitalism, etc, aren't the only view out there. But it sure as hell sucked sitting through he rants.
